thread.title: Packers' Jordan Love, Dontayvion Wicks extend lead over Bears - ESPN
thread.title_full: Packers' Jordan Love, Dontayvion Wicks extend lead over Bears - ESPN

author: Rob Demovsky
title: Packers' Jordan Love, Dontayvion Wicks extend lead over Bears - ESPN
text: GREEN BAY, Wis. -- [Green Bay Packers](/nfl/team/_/name/gb/green-bay-packers) quarterback [Jordan Love](https://www.espn.com/nfl/player/_/id/4036378/jordan-love) sure liked [Dontayvion Wicks](https://www.espn.com/nfl/player/_/id/4428850/dontayvion-wicks) on Sunday against the [Chicago Bears](/nfl/team/_/name/chi/chicago-bears). Love's first two touchdowns of the game went to the rookie receiver. There was the 13-yarder in the second quarter, followed by a 12-yarder in the third quarter, the second of which gave the Packers a 14-6 lead in their quest to win and get into the playoffs. Both came on third down. Dontayvion Wicks puts the Packers ahead!â€” NFL (@NFL) ðŸ“º: [#CHIvsGB]on CBS ðŸ“±: Stream on [#NFLPlus] [https://t.co/X0vcyHUoyR] [pic.twitter.com/Y1fZ4ntm17] [January 7, 2024] For Love, they were his 31st and 32nd touchdown passes this season, which gave him the second most in the NFL. Love, in his first season as the starter, had 14 of those touchdown passes on third downs. Only [Patrick Mahomes](https://www.espn.com/nfl/player/_/id/3139477/patrick-mahomes) has more (15). Wicks' two touchdown catches gave the Packers 31 receiving touchdowns by first- and second-year players, which is tied with the 1960 New York Titans for the second-most such scores in NFL history, trailing only the 1961 Oilers (44), according to Elias Sports Bureau. With a spot in theâ€” NFL (@NFL) [#NFLPlayoffs]on the line, Dontayvion Wicks has come to play ðŸ‘€ ðŸ“º: [#CHIvsGB]on CBS ðŸ“±: Stream on [#NFLPlus] [https://t.co/X0vcyHUoyR] [pic.twitter.com/T1ygbd0WeK] [January 7, 2024] The Packers entered the game needing to win the season finale to make the playoffs. They were in the same situation last season but lost to the Lions at home in Week 18.
